summary: The document is an FBI record from October 20, 1966, focusing on Santo Trafficante, Jr., a notable figure in organized crime. It outlines his gambling activities, including a profitable trip to London, England, and mentions his residences in Florida. The record also includes physical descriptions and passport details of Trafficante, highlighting his association with Dino Cellini, the manager of the Colony Club in London. It is clarified that the document is for internal use only, with no FBI recommendations or conclusions, and is not to be shared outside the receiving agency.
key_findings: Santo Trafficante, Jr., was actively involved in gambling during the 1960s.
His gambling activities extended to London, England, where he found them to be profitable.
Trafficante had multiple residences in Florida and was linked to Dino Cellini, who managed the Colony Club in London.
The document is an internal FBI communication, labeled as unclassified but with strict distribution restrictions.
